enum.name: GdkAnchorHints
enum.description:
Positioning hints for aligning a surface relative to a rectangle.
These hints determine how the surface should be positioned in the case that the surface would fall off-screen if placed in its ideal position.
For example, %GDK_ANCHOR_FLIP_X will replace %GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_WEST with %GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_EAST and vice versa if the surface extends beyond the left or right edges of the monitor.
If %GDK_ANCHOR_SLIDE_X is set, the surface can be shifted horizontally to fit on-screen. If %GDK_ANCHOR_RESIZE_X is set, the surface can be shrunken horizontally to fit.
In general, when multiple flags are set, flipping should take precedence over sliding, which should take precedence over resizing.

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_FLIP
parameter.parameter_description: allow flipping anchors on both axes

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_SLIDE
parameter.parameter_description: allow sliding surface on both axes

parameter.name: GDK_ANCHOR_RESIZE
parameter.parameter_description: allow resizing surface on both axes

enum.name: GdkAxisFlags
enum.description: Flags describing the current capabilities of a device/tool.

enum.name: GdkAxisUse
enum.description:
An enumeration describing the way in which a device axis (valuator) maps onto the predefined valuator types that GTK understands.
Note that the X and Y axes are not really needed; pointer devices report their location via the x/y members of events regardless. Whether X and Y are present as axes depends on the GDK backend.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_X
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the x axis.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_Y
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used as the y axis.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_PRESSURE
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pressure information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_XTILT
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for x tilt information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_YTILT
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for y tilt information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_WHEEL
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for wheel information.

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_DISTANCE
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen/tablet distance information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_ROTATION
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen rotation information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_SLIDER
parameter.parameter_description: the axis is used for pen slider information

parameter.name: GDK_AXIS_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: a constant equal to the numerically highest axis value.

Applications can connect directly to this signal, or use gtk_widget_add_tick_callback() as a more convenient interface.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_PEN

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_ERASER
parameter.parameter_description: the device is an eraser. Typically, this would be the other end of a stylus on a graphics tablet.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_CURSOR
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a graphics tablet “puck” or similar device.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a direct-input touch device, such as a touchscreen or tablet. This device type has been added in 3.4.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHPAD
parameter.parameter_description: the device is an indirect touch device, such as a touchpad. This device type has been added in 3.4.

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TRACKPOINT
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a trackpoint. This device type has been added in 3.22

parameter.name: GDK_SOURCE_TABLET_PAD
parameter.parameter_description: the device is a "pad", a collection of buttons, rings and strips found in drawing tablets. This device type has been added in 3.22.

enum.name: GdkInterpType
enum.description:
This enumeration describes the different interpolation modes that can be used with the scaling functions. @GDK_INTERP_NEAREST is the fastest scaling method, but has horrible quality when scaling down. @GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR is the best choice if you aren't sure what to choose, it has a good speed/quality balance.
**Note**: Cubic filtering is missing from the list; hyperbolic interpolation is just as fast and results in higher quality.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_NEAREST
parameter.parameter_description: Nearest neighbor sampling; this is the fastest and lowest quality mode. Quality is normally unacceptable when scaling down, but may be OK when scaling up.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_TILES
parameter.parameter_description: This is an accurate simulation of the PostScript image operator without any interpolation enabled. Each pixel is rendered as a tiny parallelogram of solid color, the edges of which are implemented with antialiasing. It resembles nearest neighbor for enlargement, and bilinear for reduction.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: Best quality/speed balance; use this mode by default. Bilinear interpolation. For enlargement, it is equivalent to point-sampling the ideal bilinear-interpolated image. For reduction, it is equivalent to laying down small tiles and integrating over the coverage area.

parameter.name: GDK_INTERP_HYPER
parameter.parameter_description: This is the slowest and highest quality reconstruction function. It is derived from the hyperbolic filters in Wolberg's "Digital Image Warping", and is formally defined as the hyperbolic-filter sampling the ideal hyperbolic-filter interpolated image (the filter is designed to be idempotent for 1:1 pixel mapping). **Deprecated**: this interpolation filter is deprecated, as in reality it has a lower quality than the @GDK_INTERP_BILINEAR filter (Since: 2.38)

enum.name: GdkKeyMatch
enum.description: The possible return values from gdk_key_event_matches() describe how well an event matches a given keyval and modifiers.

parameter.name: GDK_KEY_MATCH_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: The key event does not match

parameter.name: GDK_KEY_MATCH_PARTIAL
parameter.parameter_description: The key event matches if keyboard state (specifically, the currently active group) is ignored

enum.name: GdkMemoryFormat
enum.description:
#GdkMemoryFormat describes a format that bytes can have in memory.
It describes formats by listing the contents of the memory passed to it. So GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8 will be 1 byte (8 bits) of alpha, followed by a byte each of red, green and blue. It is not endian-dependent, so CAIRO_FORMAT_ARGB32 is represented by different #GdkMemoryFormats on architectures with different endiannesses.
Its naming is modelled after VkFormat (see https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0/html/vkspec.html#VkFormat for details).

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8A8_PREMULTIPLIED
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for blue, green, red, alpha. The color values are premultiplied with the alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8_PREMULTIPLIED
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, red, green, blue. The color values are premultiplied with the alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8A8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for blue, green, red, alpha.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8R8G8B8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, red, green, blue.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R8G8B8A8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for red, green, blue, alpha.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_A8B8G8R8
parameter.parameter_description: 4 bytes; for alpha, blue, green, red.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_R8G8B8
parameter.parameter_description: 3 bytes; for red, green, blue. The data is opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_B8G8R8
parameter.parameter_description: 3 bytes; for blue, green, red. The data is opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_MEMORY_N_FORMATS
parameter.parameter_description: The number of formats. This value will change as more formats get added, so do not rely on its concrete integer.

enum.name: GdkModifierType
enum.description:
A set of bit-flags to indicate the state of modifier keys and mouse buttons in various event types. Typical modifier keys are Shift, Control, Meta, Super, Hyper, Alt, Compose, Apple, CapsLock or ShiftLock.
Note that GDK may add internal values to events which include values outside of this enumeration. Your code should preserve and ignore them. You can use %GDK_MODIFIER_MASK to remove all private values.

parameter.name: GDK_LOCK_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: a Lock key (depending on the modifier mapping of the X server this may either be CapsLock or ShiftLock).

parameter.name: GDK_ALT_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: the fourth modifier key (it depends on the modifier mapping of the X server which key is interpreted as this modifier, but normally it is the Alt key).

signal.name: GdkMonitor::invalidate
signal.description: The ::invalidate signal gets emitted when the output represented by @monitor gets disconnected.

parameter.name: monitor
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which this signal was emitted

enum.name: GdkNotifyType
enum.description:
Specifies the kind of crossing for enter and leave events.
See the X11 protocol specification of LeaveNotify for full details of crossing event generation.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_ANCESTOR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from an ancestor or left towards an ancestor.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_VIRTUAL
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer moves between an ancestor and an inferior of the surface.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_INFERIOR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from an inferior or left towards an inferior.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is entered from or left towards a surface which is neither an ancestor nor an inferior.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR_VIRTUAL
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer moves between two surfaces which are not ancestors of each other and the surface is part of the ancestor chain between one of these surfaces and their least common ancestor.

parameter.name: GDK_NOTIFY_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: an unknown type of enter/leave event occurred.

signal.name: GdkPaintable::invalidate-contents
signal.description:
Emitted when the contents of the @paintable change.
Examples for such an event would be videos changing to the next frame or the icon theme for an icon changing.

signal.name: GdkPaintable::invalidate-size
signal.description:
Emitted when the intrinsic size of the @paintable changes. This means the values reported by at least one of gdk_paintable_get_intrinsic_width(), gdk_paintable_get_intrinsic_height() or gdk_paintable_get_intrinsic_aspect_ratio() has changed.
Examples for such an event would be a paintable displaying the contents of a toplevel surface being resized.

enum.name: GdkPaintableFlags
enum.description: Flags about this object. Implementations use these for optimizations such as caching.

parameter.name: GDK_PAINTABLE_STATIC_SIZE
parameter.parameter_description: The size is immutable. The #GdkPaintable::invalidate-size signal will never be emitted.

parameter.name: GDK_PAINTABLE_STATIC_CONTENTS
parameter.parameter_description: The content is immutable. The #GdkPaintable::invalidate-contents signal will never be emitted.

signal.name: GdkPixbuf::pixel-bytes
signal.description:
If set, this pixbuf was created from read-only #GBytes. Replaces GdkPixbuf::pixels.
Since: 2.32

property.name: GdkPixbuf:bits-per-sample
property.description: The number of bits per sample. Currently only 8 bit per sample are supported.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:n-channels
property.description: The number of samples per pixel. Currently, only 3 or 4 samples per pixel are supported.

property.name: GdkPixbuf:rowstride
property.description: The number of bytes between the start of a row and the start of the next row. This number must (obviously) be at least as large as the width of the pixbuf.

enum.name: GdkPixbufAlphaMode
enum.description:
These values can be passed to gdk_pixbuf_xlib_render_to_drawable_alpha() to control how the alpha channel of an image should be handled. This function can create a bilevel clipping mask (black and white) and use it while painting the image. In the future, when the X Window System gets an alpha channel extension, it will be possible to do full alpha compositing onto arbitrary drawables. For now both cases fall back to a bilevel clipping mask.
Deprecated: it is unused since 2.42.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_BILEVEL
parameter.parameter_description: A bilevel clipping mask (black and white) will be created and used to draw the image. Pixels below 0.5 opacity will be considered fully transparent, and all others will be considered fully opaque.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_FULL
parameter.parameter_description: For now falls back to #GDK_PIXBUF_ALPHA_BILEVEL. In the future it will do full alpha compositing.

enum.name: GdkPixbufError
enum.description: An error code in the #GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR domain. Many gdk-pixbuf operations can cause errors in this domain, or in the #G_FILE_ERROR domain.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_CORRUPT_IMAGE
parameter.parameter_description: An image file was broken somehow.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_BAD_OPTION
parameter.parameter_description: A bad option was passed to a pixbuf save module.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION
parameter.parameter_description: Don't know how to perform the given operation on the type of image at hand.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: Generic failure code, something went wrong.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_ERROR_INCOMPLETE_ANIMATION
parameter.parameter_description: Only part of the animation was loaded.

enum.name: GdkPixbufFormatFlags
enum.description:
Flags which allow a module to specify further details about the supported operations.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_FORMAT_WRITABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the module can write out images in the format.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXBUF_FORMAT_THREADSAFE
parameter.parameter_description: the module is threadsafe. gdk-pixbuf ignores modules that are not marked as threadsafe. (Since 2.28).

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::area-prepared
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the pixbuf loader has allocated the pixbuf in the desired size. After this signal is emitted, applications can call gdk_pixbuf_loader_get_pixbuf() to fetch the partially-loaded pixbuf.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::area-updated
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a significant area of the image being loaded has been updated. Normally it means that a complete scanline has been read in, but it could be a different area as well. Applications can use this signal to know when to repaint areas of an image that is being loaded.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: X offset of upper-left corner of the updated area.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Y offset of upper-left corner of the updated area.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::closed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when gdk_pixbuf_loader_close() is called. It can be used by different parts of an application to receive notification when an image loader is closed by the code that drives it.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GdkPixbufLoader::size-prepared
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the pixbuf loader has been fed the initial amount of data that is required to figure out the size of the image that it will create. Applications can call gdk_pixbuf_loader_set_size() in response to this signal to set the desired size to which the image should be scaled.

parameter.name: loader
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the original width of the image

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the original height of the image

enum.name: GdkPixbufRotation
enum.description: The possible rotations which can be passed to gdk_pixbuf_rotate_simple(). To make them easier to use, their numerical values are the actual degrees.

property.name: GdkPixbufSimpleAnim:loop
property.description:
Whether the animation should loop when it reaches the end.
Since: 2.18

enum.name: GdkPixdataDumpType

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STREAM
parameter.parameter_description: Generate pixbuf data stream (a single string containing a serialized #GdkPixdata structure in network byte order).

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_PIXDATA_STRUCT
parameter.parameter_description: Generate #GdkPixdata structure (needs the #GdkPixdata structure definition from gdk-pixdata.h).

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_MACROS
parameter.parameter_description: Generate <function>*_ROWSTRIDE</function>, <function>*_WIDTH</function>, <function>*_HEIGHT</function>, <function>*_BYTES_PER_PIXEL</function> and <function>*_RLE_PIXEL_DATA</function> or <function>*_PIXEL_DATA</function> macro definitions for the image.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_GTYPES
parameter.parameter_description: Generate GLib data types instead of standard C data types.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_CTYPES
parameter.parameter_description: Generate standard C data types instead of GLib data types.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_DUMP_RLE_DECODER
parameter.parameter_description: Provide a <function>*_RUN_LENGTH_DECODE(image_buf, rle_data, size, bpp)</function> macro definition to decode run-length encoded image data.

enum.name: GdkPixdataType
enum.description: An enumeration containing three sets of flags for a #GdkPixdata struct: one for the used colorspace, one for the width of the samples and one for the encoding of the pixel data.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: each pixel has red, green and blue samples.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_RGBA
parameter.parameter_description: each pixel has red, green and blue samples and an alpha value.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_COLOR_TYPE_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the colortype flags of the enum.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_SAMPLE_WIDTH_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the sample width flags of the enum.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_RAW
parameter.parameter_description: the pixel data is in raw form.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_RLE
parameter.parameter_description: the pixel data is run-length encoded. Runs may be up to 127 bytes long; their length is stored in a single byte preceding the pixel data for the run. If a run is constant, its length byte has the high bit set and the pixel data consists of a single pixel which must be repeated.

parameter.name: GDK_PIXDATA_ENCODING_MASK
parameter.parameter_description: mask for the encoding flags of the enum.

enum.name: GdkScrollDirection
enum.description: Specifies the direction for scroll events.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is scrolled to the left.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is scrolled to the right.

parameter.name: GDK_SCROLL_SMOOTH
parameter.parameter_description: the scrolling is determined by the delta values in scroll events. See gdk_event_get_scroll_deltas()

signal.name: GdkSeat::device-added
signal.description: The ::device-added signal is emitted when a new input device is related to this seat.

parameter.name: seat
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkSeat::device-removed
signal.description: The ::device-removed signal is emitted when an input device is removed (e.g. unplugged).

parameter.name: seat
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GdkSeat::tool-added
signal.description:
The ::tool-added signal is emitted whenever a new tool is made known to the seat. The tool may later be assigned to a device (i.e. on proximity with a tablet). The device will emit the #GdkDevice::tool-changed signal accordingly.
A same tool may be used by several devices.

parameter.name: seat
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: tool
parameter.parameter_description: the new #GdkDeviceTool known to the seat

signal.name: GdkSeat::tool-removed
signal.description: This signal is emitted whenever a tool is no longer known to this @seat.

parameter.name: seat
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GdkSeat:display
property.description: #GdkDisplay of this seat.

enum.name: GdkSeatCapabilities
enum.description: Flags describing the seat capabilities.

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_POINTER
parameter.parameter_description: The seat has a pointer (e.g. mouse)

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_TABLET_STYLUS
parameter.parameter_description: The seat has drawing tablet(s) attached

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_TABLET_PAD
parameter.parameter_description: The seat has drawing tablet pad(s) attached

parameter.name: GDK_SEAT_CAPABILITY_ALL_POINTING
parameter.parameter_description: The union of all pointing capabilities

enum.name: GdkSubpixelLayout
enum.description: This enumeration describes how the red, green and blue components of physical pixels on an output device are laid out.

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HORIZONTAL_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is horizontal, the order is RGB

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HORIZONTAL_BGR
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is horizontal, the order is BGR

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VERTICAL_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is vertical, the order is RGB

parameter.name: GDK_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VERTICAL_BGR
parameter.parameter_description: The layout is vertical, the order is BGR

signal.name: GdkSurface::enter-montor
signal.description: Emitted when @surface starts being present on the monitor.

signal.name: GdkSurface::event
signal.description: Emitted when GDK receives an input event for @surface.
signal.return: %TRUE to indicate that the event has been handled

signal.name: GdkSurface::leave-montor
signal.description: Emitted when @surface stops being present on the monitor.

signal.name: GdkSurface::popup-layout-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the layout of a popup @surface has changed, e.g. if the popup layout was reactive and after the parent moved causing the popover to end up partially off-screen.

signal.name: GdkSurface::render
signal.description: Emitted when part of the surface needs to be redrawn.

parameter.name: region
parameter.parameter_description: the region that needs to be redrawn

signal.return: %TRUE to indicate that the signal has been handled

signal.name: GdkSurface::size-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the size of @surface is changed.
Surface size is reported in ”application pixels”, not ”device pixels” (see gdk_surface_get_scale_factor()).

property.name: GdkSurface:cursor
property.description: The mouse pointer for a #GdkSurface. See gdk_surface_set_cursor() and gdk_surface_get_cursor() for details.

property.name: GdkSurface:display
property.description: The #GdkDisplay connection of the surface. See gdk_surface_get_display() for details.

enum.name: GdkSurfaceEdge
enum.description: Determines a surface edge or corner.

enum.name: GdkSurfaceState
enum.description:
Specifies the state of a toplevel surface.
On platforms that support information about individual edges, the %GDK_SURFACE_STATE_TILED state will be set whenever any of the individual tiled states is set. On platforms that lack that support, the tiled state will give an indication of tiledness without any of the per-edge states being set.

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_FULLSCREEN
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is maximized without decorations

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_ABOVE
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is kept above other surfaces

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_BELOW
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is kept below other surfaces

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_FOCUSED
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is presented as focused (with active decorations)

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: the surface is in a tiled state

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_TOP_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the top edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_TOP_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the top edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_RIGHT_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the right edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_RIGHT_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the right edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_BOTTOM_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the bottom edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_BOTTOM_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the bottom edge is resizable

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_LEFT_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: whether the left edge is tiled

parameter.name: GDK_SURFACE_STATE_LEFT_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: whether the left edge is resizable

property.name: GdkTexture:height
property.description: The height of the texture.

property.name: GdkTexture:width
property.description: The width of the texture.

enum.name: GdkTouchpadGesturePhase
enum.description:
Specifies the current state of a touchpad gesture. All gestures are guaranteed to begin with an event with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_BEGIN, followed by 0 or several events with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_UPDATE.
A finished gesture may have 2 possible outcomes, an event with phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_END will be emitted when the gesture is considered successful, this should be used as the hint to perform any permanent changes.
Cancelled gestures may be so for a variety of reasons, due to hardware or the compositor, or due to the gesture recognition layers hinting the gesture did not finish resolutely (eg. a 3rd finger being added during a pinch gesture). In these cases, the last event will report the phase %GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_CANCEL, this should be used as a hint to undo any visible/permanent changes that were done throughout the progress of the gesture.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_END
parameter.parameter_description: The gesture was finished, changes should be permanently applied.

parameter.name: GDK_TOUCHPAD_GESTURE_PHASE_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: The gesture was cancelled, all changes should be undone.

signal.name: GdkVulkanContext::images-updated
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the images managed by this context have changed. Usually this means that the swapchain had to be recreated, for example in response to a change of the surface size.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GdkVulkanError
enum.description: Error enumeration for #GdkVulkanContext.

parameter.name: GDK_VULKAN_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED
parameter.parameter_description: Vulkan is not supported on this backend or has not been compiled in.

parameter.name: GDK_VULKAN_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Vulkan support is not available on this Surface

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_get_display
function.description: Gets the #GdkDisplay that @context is for.
function.return: the display of @context

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_desktop
function.description:
Sets the workspace on which applications will be launched when using this context when running under a window manager that supports multiple workspaces, as described in the [Extended Window Manager Hints](http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/wm-spec).
When the workspace is not specified or @desktop is set to -1, it is up to the window manager to pick one, typically it will be the current workspace.

parameter.name: desktop
parameter.parameter_description: the number of a workspace, or -1

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon
function.description:
Sets the icon for applications that are launched with this context.
Window Managers can use this information when displaying startup notification.
See also gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon_name().

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon for applications that are launched with this context. The @icon_name will be interpreted in the same way as the Icon field in desktop files. See also gdk_app_launch_context_set_icon().
If both @icon and @icon_name are set, the @icon_name takes priority. If neither @icon or @icon_name is set, the icon is taken from either the file that is passed to launched application or from the #GAppInfo for the launched application itself.

function.name: gdk_app_launch_context_set_timestamp
function.description:
Sets the timestamp of @context. The timestamp should ideally be taken from the event that triggered the launch.
Window managers can use this information to avoid moving the focus to the newly launched application when the user is busy typing in another window. This is also known as 'focus stealing prevention'.

function.name: gdk_button_event_get_button
function.description: Extract the button number from a button event.
function.return: the button of @event

function.name: gdk_cairo_context_cairo_create
function.description:
Retrieves a Cairo context to be used to draw on the #GdkSurface of @context. A call to gdk_draw_context_begin_frame() with this @context must have been done or this function will return %NULL.
The returned context is guaranteed to be valid until gdk_draw_context_end_frame() is called.
function.return: a Cairo context to be used to draw the contents of the #GdkSurface. %NULL is returned when @contet is not drawing.

function.name: gdk_cairo_draw_from_gl
function.description:
This is the main way to draw GL content in GTK. It takes a render buffer ID (@source_type == #GL_RENDERBUFFER) or a texture id (@source_type == #GL_TEXTURE) and draws it onto @cr with an OVER operation, respecting the current clip. The top left corner of the rectangle specified by @x, @y, @width and @height will be drawn at the current (0,0) position of the cairo_t.
This will work for *all* cairo_t, as long as @surface is realized, but the fallback implementation that reads back the pixels from the buffer may be used in the general case. In the case of direct drawing to a surface with no special effects applied to @cr it will however use a more efficient approach.
For #GL_RENDERBUFFER the code will always fall back to software for buffers with alpha components, so make sure you use #GL_TEXTURE if using alpha.
Calling this may change the current GL context.

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: The surface we're rendering for (not necessarily into)

parameter.name: source
parameter.parameter_description: The GL ID of the source buffer

parameter.name: buffer_scale
parameter.parameter_description: The scale-factor that the @source buffer is allocated for

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The source x position in @source to start copying from in GL coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The source y position in @source to start copying from in GL coordinates

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: The width of the region to draw

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: The height of the region to draw

function.name: gdk_cairo_rectangle
function.description: Adds the given rectangle to the current path of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cairo_region
function.description: Adds the given region to the current path of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cairo_region_create_from_surface
function.description:
Creates region that describes covers the area where the given @surface is more than 50% opaque.
This function takes into account device offsets that might be set with cairo_surface_set_device_offset().
function.return: A #cairo_region_t; must be freed with cairo_region_destroy()

function.name: gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets the given pixbuf as the source pattern for @cr.
The pattern has an extend mode of %CAIRO_EXTEND_NONE and is aligned so that the origin of @pixbuf is @pixbuf_x, @pixbuf_y.

parameter.name: pixbuf_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

parameter.name: pixbuf_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

function.name: gdk_cairo_set_source_rgba
function.description: Sets the specified #GdkRGBA as the source color of @cr.

function.name: gdk_cairo_surface_upload_to_gl
function.description: Uploads the contents of a Cairo @surface to a GL texture @target.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkGLContext, or %NULL to use the currently bound context

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_content
function.return: The content of a clipboard or %NULL if the clipboard does not maintain any content.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_display
function.description: Gets the #GdkDisplay that the clipboard was created for.
function.return: a #GdkDisplay

function.name: gdk_clipboard_get_formats
function.description: Gets the formats that the clipboard can provide its current contents in.
function.return: The formats of the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_is_local
function.description:
Returns if the clipboard is local. A clipboard is considered local if it was last claimed by the running application.
Note that gdk_clipboard_get_content() may return %NULL even on a local clipboard. In this case the clipboard is empty.
function.return: %TRUE if the clipboard is local

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_async
function.description:
Asynchronously requests an input stream to read the @clipboard's contents from. When the operation is finished @callback will be called. You can then call gdk_clipboard_read_finish() to get the result of the operation.
The clipboard will choose the most suitable mime type from the given list to fulfill the request, preferring the ones listed first.

parameter.name: mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated array of mime types to choose from

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read started with gdk_clipboard_read_async().

parameter.name: out_mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store the chosen mime type in or %NULL

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: a #GInputStream or %NULL on error.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_text_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to a string. When the operation is finished @callback will be called. You can then call gdk_clipboard_read_text_finish() to get the result.
This is a simple wrapper around gdk_clipboard_read_value_async(). Use that function or gdk_clipboard_read_async() directly if you need more control over the operation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_text_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read started with gdk_clipboard_read_text_async().

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: a new string or %NULL on error.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_texture_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to a #GdkPixbuf. When the operation is finished @callback will be called. You can then call gdk_clipboard_read_texture_finish() to get the result.
This is a simple wrapper around gdk_clipboard_read_value_async(). Use that function or gdk_clipboard_read_async() directly if you need more control over the operation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_texture_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read started with gdk_clipboard_read_texture_async().

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: a new #GdkTexture or %NULL on error.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_value_async
function.description:
Asynchronously request the @clipboard contents converted to the given @type. When the operation is finished @callback will be called. You can then call gdk_clipboard_read_value_finish() to get the resulting #GValue.
For local clipboard contents that are available in the given #GType, the value will be copied directly. Otherwise, GDK will try to use gdk_content_deserialize_async() to convert the clipboard's data.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_read_value_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous clipboard read started with gdk_clipboard_read_value_async().

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: a #GValue containing the result.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set
function.description: Sets the clipboard to contain the value collected from the given varargs.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_content
function.description:
Sets a new content provider on @clipboard. The clipboard will claim the #GdkDisplay's resources and advertise these new contents to other applications.
In the rare case of a failure, this function will return %FALSE. The clipboard will then continue reporting its old contents and ignore @provider.
If the contents are read by either an external application or the @clipboard's read functions, @clipboard will select the best format to transfer the contents and then request that format from @provider.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: the new contents of @clipboard or %NULL to clear the clipboard

function.return: %TRUE if setting the clipboard succeeded

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_text
function.description: Puts the given @text into the clipboard.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: Text to put into the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_texture
function.description: Puts the given @texture into the clipboard.

parameter.name: texture
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkTexture to put into the clipboard

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_valist
function.description: Sets the clipboard to contain the value collected from the given @args.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_set_value
function.description: Sets the @clipboard to contain the given @value.

function.name: gdk_clipboard_store_async
function.description:
Asynchronously instructs the @clipboard to store its contents remotely to preserve them for later usage. If the clipboard is not local, this function does nothing but report success.
This function is called automatically when gtk_main() or #GtkApplication exit, so you likely don't need to call it.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_clipboard_store_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous clipboard store started with gdk_clipboard_store_async().

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if storing was successful.

function.name: gdk_configure_event_get_size

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_formats
function.description: Appends all formats from @formats to @builder, skipping those that already exist.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_gtype
function.description: Appends @gtype to @builder if it has not already been added.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_add_mime_type
function.description: Appends @mime_type to @builder if it has not already been added.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_free_to_formats
function.description: Creates a new #GdkContentFormats from the current state of the given @builder, and frees the @builder instance.
function.return: the newly created #GdkContentFormats with all the formats added to @builder

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_new
function.description: Create a new #GdkContentFormatsBuilder object. The resulting builder would create an empty #GdkContentFormats. Use addition functions to add types to it.
function.return: a new #GdkContentFormatsBuilder

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_ref
function.description:
Acquires a reference on the given @builder.
This function is intended primarily for bindings. #GdkContentFormatsBuilder objects should not be kept around.
function.return: the given #GdkContentFormatsBuilder with its reference count increased

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_to_formats
function.description:
Creates a new #GdkContentFormats from the given @builder.
The given #GdkContentFormatsBuilder is reset once this function returns; you cannot call this function multiple times on the same @builder instance.
This function is intended primarily for bindings. C code should use gdk_content_formats_builder_free_to_formats().
function.return: the newly created #GdkContentFormats with all the formats added to @builder

function.name: gdk_content_formats_builder_unref
function.description: Releases a reference on the given @builder.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_contain_gtype
function.description: Checks if a given #GType is part of the given @formats.
function.return: %TRUE if the #GType was found

function.name: gdk_content_formats_contain_mime_type
function.description: Checks if a given mime type is part of the given @formats.

parameter.name: mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: the mime type to search for

function.return: %TRUE if the mime_type was found

function.name: gdk_content_formats_get_gtypes
function.description: Gets the #GTypes included in @formats. Note that @formats may not contain any #GTypes, in particular when they are empty. In that case %NULL will be returned.

parameter.name: n_gtypes
parameter.parameter_description: optional pointer to take the number of #GTypes contained in the return value

function.return: %G_TYPE_INVALID-terminated array of types included in @formats or %NULL if none.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_get_mime_types
function.description: Gets the mime types included in @formats. Note that @formats may not contain any mime types, in particular when they are empty. In that case %NULL will be returned.

parameter.name: n_mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: optional pointer to take the number of mime types contained in the return value

function.return: %NULL-terminated array of interned strings of mime types included in @formats or %NULL if none.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match
function.description: Checks if @first and @second have any matching formats.
function.return: %TRUE if a matching format was found.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match_gtype
function.description: Finds the first #GType from @first that is also contained in @second. If no matching #GType is found, %G_TYPE_INVALID is returned.
function.return: The first common #GType or %G_TYPE_INVALID if none.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_match_mime_type
function.description: Finds the first mime type from @first that is also contained in @second. If no matching mime type is found, %NULL is returned.
function.return: The first common mime type or %NULL if none.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GdkContentFormats from an array of mime types.
The mime types must be valid and different from each other or the behavior of the return value is undefined. If you cannot guarantee this, use #GdkContentFormatsBuilder instead.

parameter.name: mime_types
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to an array of mime types

function.return: the new #GdkContentFormats.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_new_for_gtype
function.description: Creates a new #GdkContentFormats for a given #GType.
function.return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_print
function.description:
Prints the given @formats into a string for human consumption. This is meant for debugging and logging.
The form of the representation may change at any time and is not guaranteed to stay identical.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of a #GdkContentFormats by one.
function.return: the passed in #GdkContentFormats.

function.name: gdk_content_formats_to_string
function.description: Prints the given @formats into a human-readable string. This is a small wrapper around gdk_content_formats_print() to help when debugging.
function.return: a new string

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union
function.description: Append all missing types from @second to @first, in the order they had in @second.
function.return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_deserialize_gtypes
function.description:
Add GTypes for mime types in @formats for which deserializers are registered.
Return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_deserialize_mime_types
function.description:
Add mime types for GTypes in @formats for which deserializers are registered.
Return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_serialize_gtypes
function.description:
Add GTypes for the mime types in @formats for which serializers are registered.
Return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_union_serialize_mime_types
function.description:
Add mime types for GTypes in @formats for which serializers are registered.
Return: a new #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_content_formats_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of a #GdkContentFormats by one. If the resulting reference count is zero, frees the formats.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_content_changed
function.description: Emits the #GdkContentProvider::content-changed signal.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_get_value
function.description:
Gets the contents of @provider stored in @value.
The @value will have been initialized to the #GType the value should be provided in. This given #GType does not need to be listed in the formats returned by gdk_content_provider_ref_formats(). However, if the given #GType is not supported, this operation can fail and #G_IO_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED will be reported.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the value was set successfully. Otherwise @error will be set to describe the failure.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_for_bytes
function.description: Create a content provider that provides the given @bytes as data for the given @mime_type.

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_for_value
function.description: Create a content provider that provides the given @value.
function.return: a new #GdkContentProvider

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_typed
function.description:
Create a content provider that provides the value of the given @type.
The value is provided using G_VALUE_COLLECT(), so the same rules apply as when calling g_object_new() or g_object_set().
function.return: a new #GdkContentProvider

function.name: gdk_content_provider_new_union

parameter.name: providers
parameter.parameter_description: The #GdkContentProviders to present the union of

function.return: a new #GdkContentProvider

function.description: Gets the formats that the provider can provide its current contents in.
function.return: The formats of the provider

function.name: gdk_content_provider_ref_storable_formats
function.description:
Gets the formats that the provider suggests other applications to store the data in. An example of such an application would be a clipboard manager.
This can be assumed to be a subset of gdk_content_provider_ref_formats().
function.return: The storable formats of the provider

function.name: gdk_content_provider_write_mime_type_async
function.description:
Asynchronously writes the contents of @provider to @stream in the given @mime_type. When the operation is finished @callback will be called. You can then call gdk_content_provider_write_mime_type_finish() to get the result of the operation.
The given mime type does not need to be listed in the formats returned by gdk_content_provider_ref_formats(). However, if the given #GType is not supported, #G_IO_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED will be reported.
The given @stream will not be closed.

parameter.name: mime_type
parameter.parameter_description: the mime type to provide the data in

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: callback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: gdk_content_provider_write_mime_type_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous write operation started with gdk_content_provider_write_mime_type_async().

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError location to store the error occurring, or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the operation was completed successfully. Otherwise @error will be set to describe the failure.

function.name: gdk_crossing_event_get_detail
function.description: Extracts the notify detail from a crossing event.
function.return: the notify detail of @event

function.name: gdk_crossing_event_get_focus
function.description: Checks if the @event surface is the focus surface.
function.return: %TRUE if the surface is the focus surface

function.name: gdk_crossing_event_get_mode
function.description: Extracts the crossing mode from a crossing event.
function.return: the mode of @event

function.name: gdk_cursor_get_fallback
function.description:
Returns the fallback for this @cursor. The fallback will be used if this cursor is not available on a given #GdkDisplay.
For named cursors, this can happen when using nonstandard names or when using an incomplete cursor theme. For textured cursors, this can happen when the texture is too large or when the #GdkDisplay it is used on does not support textured cursors.
function.return: the fallback of the cursor or %NULL to use the default cursor as fallback.

function.name: gdk_cursor_get_hotspot_x
function.description: Returns the horizontal offset of the hotspot. The hotspot indicates the pixel that will be directly above the cursor.
function.return: the horizontal offset of the hotspot or 0 for named cursors

function.name: gdk_cursor_get_hotspot_y
function.description: Returns the vertical offset of the hotspot. The hotspot indicates the pixel that will be directly above the cursor.
function.return: the vertical offset of the hotspot or 0 for named cursors

function.name: gdk_cursor_get_name
function.description: Returns the name of the cursor. If the cursor is not a named cursor, %NULL will be returned and the GdkCursor::texture property will be set.
function.return: the name of the cursor or %NULL if it is not a named cursor

function.name: gdk_cursor_get_texture
function.description: Returns the texture for the cursor. If the cursor is a named cursor, %NULL will be returned and the GdkCursor::name property will be set.
function.return: the texture for cursor or %NULL if it is a named cursor

function.name: gdk_cursor_new_from_name
function.description:
Creates a new cursor by looking up @name in the current cursor theme.
A recommended set of cursor names that will work across different platforms can be found in the CSS specification: - "none" - ![](default_cursor.png) "default" - ![](help_cursor.png) "help" - ![](pointer_cursor.png) "pointer" - ![](context_menu_cursor.png) "context-menu" - ![](progress_cursor.png) "progress" - ![](wait_cursor.png) "wait" - ![](cell_cursor.png) "cell" - ![](crosshair_cursor.png) "crosshair" - ![](text_cursor.png) "text" - ![](vertical_text_cursor.png) "vertical-text" - ![](alias_cursor.png) "alias" - ![](copy_cursor.png) "copy" - ![](no_drop_cursor.png) "no-drop" - ![](move_cursor.png) "move" - ![](not_allowed_cursor.png) "not-allowed" - ![](grab_cursor.png) "grab" - ![](grabbing_cursor.png) "grabbing" - ![](all_scroll_cursor.png) "all-scroll" - ![](col_resize_cursor.png) "col-resize" - ![](row_resize_cursor.png) "row-resize" - ![](n_resize_cursor.png) "n-resize" - ![](e_resize_cursor.png) "e-resize" - ![](s_resize_cursor.png) "s-resize" - ![](w_resize_cursor.png) "w-resize" - ![](ne_resize_cursor.png) "ne-resize" - ![](nw_resize_cursor.png) "nw-resize" - ![](sw_resize_cursor.png) "sw-resize" - ![](se_resize_cursor.png) "se-resize" - ![](ew_resize_cursor.png) "ew-resize" - ![](ns_resize_cursor.png) "ns-resize" - ![](nesw_resize_cursor.png) "nesw-resize" - ![](nwse_resize_cursor.png) "nwse-resize" - ![](zoom_in_cursor.png) "zoom-in" - ![](zoom_out_cursor.png) "zoom-out"

parameter.name: fallback
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL or the #GdkCursor to fall back to when this one cannot be supported

function.return: a new #GdkCursor, or %NULL if there is no cursor with the given name

function.name: gdk_cursor_new_from_texture
function.description: Creates a new cursor from a #GdkTexture.

parameter.name: texture
parameter.parameter_description: the texture providing the pixel data

parameter.name: hotspot_x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal offset of the “hotspot” of the cursor

parameter.name: hotspot_y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical offset of the “hotspot” of the cursor

parameter.name: fallback
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL or the #GdkCursor to fall back to when this one cannot be supported

function.return: a new #GdkCursor.

function.name: gdk_device_free_history
function.description: Frees an array of #GdkTimeCoord that was returned by gdk_device_get_history().

function.name: gdk_device_get_associated_device
function.description:
Returns the associated device to @device, if @device is of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_MASTER, it will return the paired pointer or keyboard.
If @device is of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_SLAVE, it will return the master device to which @device is attached to.
If @device is of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_FLOATING, %NULL will be returned, as there is no associated device.
function.return: The associated device, or %NULL

function.name: gdk_device_get_axes
function.description: Returns the axes currently available on the device.

function.description: Interprets an array of double as axis values for a given device, and locates the value in the array for a given axis use.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the found value.

function.return: %TRUE if the given axis use was found, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gdk_device_get_axis_names
function.description: Returns a null-terminated array of strings, containing the labels for the axes that @device currently has. If the device has no axes, %NULL is returned.
function.return: A null-terminated string array, free with g_strfreev().

function.name: gdk_device_get_axis_use
function.description: Returns the axis use for @index_.

function.name: gdk_device_get_axis_value
function.description: Interprets an array of double as axis values for a given device, and locates the value in the array for a given axis label, as returned by gdk_device_get_axes()

parameter.parameter_description: pointer to an array of axes

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the found value.

function.return: %TRUE if the given axis use was found, otherwise %FALSE.

function.description: Retrieves the #GdkDeviceTool associated to @device.
function.return: the #GdkDeviceTool

function.name: gdk_device_get_device_type
function.description: Returns the device type for @device.
function.return: the #GdkDeviceType for @device.

function.name: gdk_device_get_display
function.description: Returns the #GdkDisplay to which @device pertains.
function.return: a #GdkDisplay. This memory is owned by GTK+, and must not be freed or unreffed.

function.name: gdk_device_get_has_cursor
function.description: Determines whether the pointer follows device motion. This is not meaningful for keyboard devices, which don't have a pointer.
function.return: %TRUE if the pointer follows device motion

function.name: gdk_device_get_history
function.description:
Obtains the motion history for a pointer device; given a starting and ending timestamp, return all events in the motion history for the device in the given range of time. Some windowing systems do not support motion history, in which case, %FALSE will be returned. (This is not distinguishable from the case where motion history is supported and no events were found.)
Note that there is also gdk_surface_set_event_compression() to get more motion events delivered directly, independent of the windowing system.

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: the surface with respect to which which the event coordinates will be reported

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: starting timestamp for range of events to return

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: ending timestamp for the range of events to return

parameter.name: events
parameter.parameter_description: location to store a newly-allocated array of #GdkTimeCoord, or %NULL

parameter.name: n_events
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the length of @events, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the windowing system supports motion history and at least one event was found.

function.name: gdk_device_get_key
function.description: If @index_ has a valid keyval, this function will return %TRUE and fill in @keyval and @modifiers with the keyval settings.

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the macro button to get.

function.return: %TRUE if keyval is set for @index.

function.name: gdk_device_get_last_event_surface
function.description: Gets information about which surface the given pointer device is in, based on events that have been received so far from the display server. If another application has a pointer grab, or this application has a grab with owner_events = %FALSE, %NULL may be returned even if the pointer is physically over one of this application's surfaces.

parameter.name: device
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkDevice, with a source other than %GDK_SOURCE_KEYBOARD

function.return: the last surface the device

function.name: gdk_device_get_n_keys
function.description: Returns the number of keys the device currently has.
function.return: the number of keys.

function.name: gdk_device_get_name
function.description: Determines the name of the device.
function.return: a name

function.name: gdk_device_get_num_touches
function.description: Retrieves the number of touch points associated to @device.
function.return: the number of touch points

function.name: gdk_device_get_product_id
function.description: Returns the product ID of this device, or %NULL if this information couldn't be obtained. This ID is retrieved from the device, and is thus constant for it. See gdk_device_get_vendor_id() for more information.
function.return: the product ID, or %NULL

function.name: gdk_device_get_seat
function.description: Returns the #GdkSeat the device belongs to.
function.return: A #GdkSeat. This memory is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed.

function.name: gdk_device_get_source
function.description: Determines the type of the device.
function.return: a #GdkInputSource

function.name: gdk_device_get_state
function.description: Gets the current state of a pointer device relative to @surface. As a slave device’s coordinates are those of its master pointer, this function may not be called on devices of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_SLAVE, unless there is an ongoing grab on them. See gdk_seat_grab().

parameter.name: axes
parameter.parameter_description: an array of doubles to store the values of the axes of @device in, or %NULL.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the modifiers, or %NULL.

function.name: gdk_device_get_surface_at_position
function.description:
Obtains the surface underneath @device, returning the location of the device in @win_x and @win_y in double precision. Returns %NULL if the surface tree under @device is not known to GDK (for example, belongs to another application).
As a slave device coordinates are those of its master pointer, This function may not be called on devices of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_SLAVE, unless there is an ongoing grab on them, see gdk_seat_grab().

parameter.name: win_x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the X coordinate of the device location, relative to the surface origin, or %NULL.

parameter.name: win_y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the Y coordinate of the device location, relative to the surface origin, or %NULL.

function.return: the #GdkSurface under the device position, or %NULL.

function.name: gdk_device_get_vendor_id
function.return: the vendor ID, or %NULL

function.name: gdk_device_list_slave_devices
function.description: If the device if of type %GDK_DEVICE_TYPE_MASTER, it will return the list of slave devices attached to it, otherwise it will return %NULL
function.return: the list of slave devices, or %NULL. The list must be freed with g_list_free(), the contents of the list are owned by GTK+ and should not be freed.

function.name: gdk_device_pad_get_feature_group
function.description: Returns the group the given @feature and @idx belong to, or -1 if feature/index do not exist in @pad.

parameter.name: feature
parameter.parameter_description: the feature type to get the group from

parameter.name: feature_idx
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the feature to get the group from

function.return: The group number of the queried pad feature.

function.name: gdk_device_pad_get_group_n_modes
function.description: Returns the number of modes that @group may have.

parameter.name: group_idx
parameter.parameter_description: group to get the number of available modes from

function.return: The number of modes available in @group.

function.name: gdk_device_pad_get_n_features
function.description: Returns the number of features a tablet pad has.
function.return: The amount of elements of type @feature that this pad has.

function.name: gdk_device_pad_get_n_groups
function.description: Returns the number of groups this pad device has. Pads have at least one group. A pad group is a subcollection of buttons/strip/rings that is affected collectively by a same current mode.
function.return: The number of button/ring/strip groups in the pad.

function.name: gdk_device_set_axis_use
function.description: Specifies how an axis of a device is used.

parameter.name: use
parameter.parameter_description: specifies how the axis is used

function.name: gdk_device_set_key
function.description: Specifies the X key event to generate when a macro button of a device is pressed.

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the macro button to set

function.name: gdk_device_tool_get_hardware_id
function.description:
Gets the hardware ID of this tool, or 0 if it's not known. When non-zero, the identificator is unique for the given tool model, meaning that two identical tools will share the same @hardware_id, but will have different serial numbers (see gdk_device_tool_get_serial()).
This is a more concrete (and device specific) method to identify a #GdkDeviceTool than gdk_device_tool_get_tool_type(), as a tablet may support multiple devices with the same #GdkDeviceToolType, but having different hardware identificators.
function.return: The hardware identificator of this tool.

function.name: gdk_device_tool_get_serial
function.description: Gets the serial of this tool, this value can be used to identify a physical tool (eg. a tablet pen) across program executions.
function.return: The serial ID for this tool

function.name: gdk_device_tool_get_tool_type
function.description: Gets the #GdkDeviceToolType of the tool.
function.return: The physical type for this tool. This can be used to figure out what sort of pen is being used, such as an airbrush or a pencil.

function.name: gdk_display_beep
function.description: Emits a short beep on @display

function.name: gdk_display_close
function.description: Closes the connection to the windowing system for the given display, and cleans up associated resources.

function.name: gdk_display_device_is_grabbed
function.description: Returns %TRUE if there is an ongoing grab on @device for @display.
function.return: %TRUE if there is a grab in effect for @device.

function.name: gdk_display_flush
function.description:
Flushes any requests queued for the windowing system; this happens automatically when the main loop blocks waiting for new events, but if your application is drawing without returning control to the main loop, you may need to call this function explicitly. A common case where this function needs to be called is when an application is executing drawing commands from a thread other than the thread where the main loop is running.
This is most useful for X11. On windowing systems where requests are handled synchronously, this function will do nothing.

function.name: gdk_display_get_app_launch_context
function.description: Returns a #GdkAppLaunchContext suitable for launching applications on the given display.
function.return: a new #GdkAppLaunchContext for @display. Free with g_object_unref() when done

function.name: gdk_display_get_clipboard
function.description: Gets the clipboard used for copy/paste operations.
function.return: the display's clipboard

function.name: gdk_display_get_default
function.return: a #GdkDisplay, or %NULL if there is no default display.

function.name: gdk_display_get_default_group
function.description: Returns the default group leader surface for all toplevel surfaces on @display. This surface is implicitly created by GDK. See gdk_surface_set_group().
function.return: The default group leader surface for @display

function.name: gdk_display_get_default_seat
function.description:
Returns the default #GdkSeat for this display.
Note that a display may not have a seat. In this case, this function will return %NULL.
function.return: the default seat.

function.name: gdk_display_get_event
function.description: Gets the next #GdkEvent to be processed for @display, fetching events from the windowing system if necessary.
function.return: the next #GdkEvent to be processed, or %NULL if no events are pending

function.name: gdk_display_get_keymap
function.description: Returns the #GdkKeymap attached to @display.
function.return: the #GdkKeymap attached to @display.

function.name: gdk_display_get_monitor_at_surface
function.description: Gets the monitor in which the largest area of @surface resides, or a monitor close to @surface if it is outside of all monitors.
function.return: the monitor with the largest overlap with @surface

function.name: gdk_display_get_monitors
function.description:
Gets the list of monitors associated with this display.
Subsequent calls to this function will always return the same list for the same display.
You can listen to the GListModel::items-changed signal on this list to monitor changes to the monitor of this display.
function.return: a #GListModel of #GdkMonitor

function.name: gdk_display_get_name
function.description: Gets the name of the display.
function.return: a string representing the display name. This string is owned by GDK and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gdk_display_get_primary_clipboard
function.description: Gets the clipboard used for the primary selection. On backends where the primary clipboard is not supported natively, GDK emulates this clipboard locally.
function.return: the primary clipboard

function.name: gdk_display_get_setting
function.description: Retrieves a desktop-wide setting such as double-click time for the @display.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the value of the setting

function.return: %TRUE if the setting existed and a value was stored in @value, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gdk_display_get_startup_notification_id
function.description: Gets the startup notification ID for a Wayland display, or %NULL if no ID has been defined.
function.return: the startup notification ID for @display, or %NULL

function.name: gdk_display_has_pending
function.description: Returns whether the display has events that are waiting to be processed.
function.return: %TRUE if there are events ready to be processed.

function.name: gdk_display_is_closed
function.description: Finds out if the display has been closed.
function.return: %TRUE if the display is closed.

function.name: gdk_display_is_composited
function.description:
Returns whether surfaces can reasonably be expected to have their alpha channel drawn correctly on the screen. Check gdk_display_is_rgba() for wether the display supports an alpha channel.
On X11 this function returns whether a compositing manager is compositing on @display.
On modern displays, this value is always %TRUE.
function.return: Whether surfaces with RGBA visuals can reasonably be expected to have their alpha channels drawn correctly on the screen.

function.name: gdk_display_is_rgba
function.description:
Returns wether surfaces on this @display are created with an alpha channel.
Even if a %TRUE is returned, it is possible that the surface’s alpha channel won’t be honored when displaying the surface on the screen: in particular, for X an appropriate windowing manager and compositing manager must be running to provide appropriate display. Use gdk_display_is_composited() to check if that is the case.
For setting an overall opacity for a top-level surface, see gdk_surface_set_opacity().
On modern displays, this value is always %TRUE.
function.return: %TRUE if surfaces are created with an alpha channel or %FALSE if the display does not support this functionality.

function.name: gdk_display_list_seats
function.description: Returns the list of seats known to @display.
function.return: the list of seats known to the #GdkDisplay

function.name: gdk_display_manager_get
function.description:
Gets the singleton #GdkDisplayManager object.
When called for the first time, this function consults the `GDK_BACKEND` environment variable to find out which of the supported GDK backends to use (in case GDK has been compiled with multiple backends). Applications can use gdk_set_allowed_backends() to limit what backends can be used.

function.name: gdk_display_manager_get_default_display
function.description: Gets the default #GdkDisplay.
function.return: a #GdkDisplay, or %NULL if there is no default display.

function.name: gdk_display_manager_list_displays
function.description: List all currently open displays.
function.return: a newly allocated #GSList of #GdkDisplay objects. Free with g_slist_free() when you are done with it.

function.name: gdk_display_manager_open_display
function.description: Opens a display.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the display to open

function.return: a #GdkDisplay, or %NULL if the display could not be opened

function.name: gdk_display_manager_set_default_display
function.description: Sets @display as the default display.

function.name: gdk_display_map_keycode
function.description:
Returns the keyvals bound to @keycode. The Nth #GdkKeymapKey in @keys is bound to the Nth keyval in @keyvals.
When a keycode is pressed by the user, the keyval from this list of entries is selected by considering the effective keyboard group and level.
Free the returned arrays with g_free().

parameter.name: keys
parameter.parameter_description: return location for array of #GdkKeymapKey, or %NULL

parameter.name: keyvals
parameter.parameter_description: return location for array of keyvals, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if there were any entries

function.name: gdk_display_map_keyval
function.description:
Obtains a list of keycode/group/level combinations that will generate @keyval. Groups and levels are two kinds of keyboard mode; in general, the level determines whether the top or bottom symbol on a key is used, and the group determines whether the left or right symbol is used.
On US keyboards, the shift key changes the keyboard level, and there are no groups. A group switch key might convert a keyboard between Hebrew to English modes, for example.
#GdkEventKey contains a %group field that indicates the active keyboard group. The level is computed from the modifier mask.
The returned array should be freed with g_free().

parameter.name: keys
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an array of #GdkKeymapKey

parameter.name: n_keys
parameter.parameter_description: return location for number of elements in returned array

function.return: %TRUE if keys were found and returned

function.name: gdk_display_notify_startup_complete
function.description:
Indicates to the GUI environment that the application has finished loading, using a given identifier.
GTK+ will call this function automatically for #GtkWindow with custom startup-notification identifier unless gtk_window_set_auto_startup_notification() is called to disable that feature.

parameter.name: startup_id
parameter.parameter_description: a startup-notification identifier, for which notification process should be completed

function.name: gdk_display_open
function.description: Opens a display.

parameter.name: display_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the display to open

function.return: a #GdkDisplay, or %NULL if the display could not be opened

function.name: gdk_display_peek_event
function.description: Gets a copy of the first #GdkEvent in the @display’s event queue, without removing the event from the queue. (Note that this function will not get more events from the windowing system. It only checks the events that have already been moved to the GDK event queue.)
function.return: the first #GdkEvent on the event queue

function.name: gdk_display_put_event
function.description: Appends the given event onto the front of the event queue for @display.

function.name: gdk_display_supports_input_shapes
function.description: Returns %TRUE if gdk_surface_input_shape_combine_mask() can be used to modify the input shape of surfaces on @display.
function.return: %TRUE if surfaces with modified input shape are supported

function.name: gdk_display_sync
function.description:
Flushes any requests queued for the windowing system and waits until all requests have been handled. This is often used for making sure that the display is synchronized with the current state of the program. Calling gdk_display_sync() before gdk_error_trap_pop() makes sure that any errors generated from earlier requests are handled before the error trap is removed.
This is most useful for X11. On windowing systems where requests are handled synchronously, this function will do nothing.

function.name: gdk_dnd_event_get_drop
function.description: Gets the #GdkDrop from a DND event.
function.return: the drop

function.name: gdk_drag_action_is_unique
function.description:
Checks if @action represents a single action or if it includes multiple flags that can be selected from.
When @action is 0 - ie no action was given, %TRUE is returned.
function.return: %TRUE if exactly one action was given

function.name: gdk_drag_begin
function.description:
Starts a drag and creates a new drag context for it.
This function is called by the drag source. After this call, you probably want to set up the drag icon using the surface returned by gdk_drag_get_drag_surface().
This function returns a reference to the GdkDrag object, but GTK keeps its own reference as well, as long as the DND operation is going on.
Note: if @actions include %GDK_ACTION_MOVE, you need to listen for the #GdkDrag::dnd-finished signal and delete the data at the source if gdk_drag_get_selected_action() returns %GDK_ACTION_MOVE.

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: the source surface for this drag

parameter.name: device
parameter.parameter_description: the device that controls this drag

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the actions supported by this drag

parameter.name: dx
parameter.parameter_description: the x offset to @device's position where the drag nominally started

parameter.name: dy
parameter.parameter_description: the y offset to @device's position where the drag nominally started

function.return: a newly created #GdkDrag or %NULL on error.

function.name: gdk_drag_drop_done
function.description:
Inform GDK if the drop ended successfully. Passing %FALSE for @success may trigger a drag cancellation animation.
This function is called by the drag source, and should be the last call before dropping the reference to the @drag.
The #GdkDrag will only take the first gdk_drag_drop_done() call as effective, if this function is called multiple times, all subsequent calls will be ignored.

parameter.name: success
parameter.parameter_description: whether the drag was ultimatively successful

function.name: gdk_drag_get_actions
function.description: Determines the bitmask of possible actions proposed by the source.
function.return: the #GdkDragAction flags

function.name: gdk_drag_get_content
function.description: Returns the #GdkContentProvider associated to the GdkDrag object.
function.return: The #GdkContentProvider associated to @drag.

function.name: gdk_drag_get_device
function.description: Returns the #GdkDevice associated to the GdkDrag object.
function.return: The #GdkDevice associated to @drag.

function.name: gdk_drag_get_display
function.description: Gets the #GdkDisplay that the drag object was created for.
function.return: a #GdkDisplay

function.name: gdk_drag_get_drag_surface
function.description: Returns the surface on which the drag icon should be rendered during the drag operation. Note that the surface may not be available until the drag operation has begun. GDK will move the surface in accordance with the ongoing drag operation. The surface is owned by @drag and will be destroyed when the drag operation is over.
function.return: the drag surface, or %NULL

function.name: gdk_drag_get_formats
function.description: Retrieves the formats supported by this GdkDrag object.
function.return: a #GdkContentFormats

function.name: gdk_drag_get_selected_action
function.description: Determines the action chosen by the drag destination.
function.return: a #GdkDragAction value

function.name: gdk_drag_get_surface
